page.title: 18HELBECK HALL , BROUGH
page.content: IN 1160 THE DE HELBECKS LIVED AT HELLBECK HALL. THEY WERE THE LORDS OF THE MANOR. IN 1325 THE MANOR WAS PASSED ON TO THE BLENKINSOP FAMILY FROM NORTHUMBERLAND. THEN IN 1589 THE BLENKINSOPS WHO WERE ROMAN CATHOLICS AND ROYALISTS SUFFERED DURING THE TIME OF CROMWELL.FRANCIS BLENKINSOP WAS THE LAST OF THE BLENKINSOPS.THEY HAD LIVED AT HELBECK HALL FOR 300 YEARS AND HE DIED IN BROUGH. THEN IN 1776 JOHN METCALF CARLTON BUILT THE FOX TOWER NEAR BY THE BACK OF THE HOUSE.IT WAS MOSTLY MADE FOR THE VIEW BUT WAS SAID TO BE A LOOK OUT. HE ALSO BUILT A COTTON_MILL AND IT IS NOW A FARM HOUSE. MR ANDREW JAMES BLACKETT_ORD CAME TO LIVE AT HELBECK BECAUSE HE WAS RELATED TO THE FAMILY .NOW HE IS A HIGH COURT JUDGE.
